docs.snippet: Foreign exchange passed through a quiet and uneventful week. Business was in good volume, but so far British sterling was concerned it fell slightly under that done during the height of the dollar demand in London several weeks back.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange passed through a quiet and uneventful week. Business was in good volume, but so far British sterling was concerned it fell slightly under that done during the height of the dollar demand in London several weeks back.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 22, 1954
CANADA AND ISRAEL GAIN; 2 Victors Enter Final Round in World Basketball Event

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 (AP) -- The United States, represented by the Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars, won the opening game of the final round of the world basketball tournament today with a 56-43 victory over the Philippines.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 (AP) -- The United States, represented by the Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars, won the opening game of the final round of the world basketball tournament today with a 56-43 victory over the Philippines.

headline.main: U. S. FIVE DEFEATS PHILIPPINES, 56-43; Rally by Peoria Caterpillars Wins in World Tourney -- Canada Halts Israel

docs.snippet: Dr. Edward Larocque Tinker, author and president of the Uruguayan - American Association, was honored in ceremonies yesterday celebrating the associations's second anniversary.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Edward Larocque Tinker, author and president of the Uruguayan - American Association, was honored in ceremonies yesterday celebrating the associations's second anniversary.

headline.main: DR. TINKER IS HONORED; Reception Marks Second Year of Uruguayan-American Group

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 28 -- The American Civil Liberties Union charged today that the United States was putting pressures on employes of international agencies that would destroy their integrity.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 28 -- The American Civil Liberties Union charged today that the United States was putting pressures on employes of international agencies that would destroy their integrity.
docs.abstract: ACLU charges US puts pressures on internatl agencies employes that would destroy their integrity, lr to Lodge criticizing attack on Evans; US delegation aide says Lodge did not seek to influence Evans

headline.main: U. S. MOVE ON AIDES IN U. N. IS ASSAILED; Civil Liberties Union Scores Pressure to Oust Personnel Under Loyalty Charges

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: 80 naval officers held for signing petition urging promotion system revision and endorsing similar Army petition
docs.abstract: 80 naval officers held for signing petition urging promotion system revision and endorsing similar Army petition

headline.main: Uruguay Jails 80 in Navy In Fight Over Promotion

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 28 (AP) -- The Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars gained an early lead and easily defeated France, 70 -- 49, tonight in the world basketball tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 28 (AP) -- The Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars gained an early lead and easily defeated France, 70 -- 49, tonight in the world basketball tournament.

headline.main: AMERICAN QUINTET TOPS FRANCE, 70-49; Peoria Caterpillars Triumph Handily in World Amateur Play -- Canada Is Victor

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 29 (AP)--A fast-breaking Uruguay team caught the Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars off balance tonight, but the United States entry finally gained a 64-59 victory for its fifth straight success in the world basketball championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 29 (AP)--A fast-breaking Uruguay team caught the Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars off balance tonight, but the United States entry finally gained a 64-59 victory for its fifth straight success in the world basketball championship.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE DEFEATS URUGUAY, 64 TO 59; Peoria Caterpillars Register Fifth Straight Triumph in Tournament in Brazil

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 29 -- The United States plan for peaceful uses of atomic energy requires much clarification and elaboration, Dr. Pierre Auger, French physicist, said here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 29 -- The United States plan for peaceful uses of atomic energy requires much clarification and elaboration, Dr. Pierre Auger, French physicist, said here today.
docs.abstract: Dr Auger sees solar energy more practical than atomic for underdeveloped areas

headline.main: French Scientist Bids U.S. Offer More Details of Atomic Proposal; UNESCO Aide Asserts Plan Is Vague on Membership of the World Agency
